result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee A Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lee A Hamilton

defendant.name: Hamilton, Lee A
defendant.address: 2300 West Good Hope Road Apt. 346, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Petitioner Lee A Hamilton in court.  Colette Catherine Reinke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return of property hearing. Court denies petitioners request for return of property.
Return of property hearing at 02-02-2016 01:30 pm

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for seeking employment and employment and schooling.    Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees with a payment plan of $50.00 per month commencing on 11-15-2015 and to be paid on the 15th of every month until paid in full.
COURT ORDERED Defendant to establish paternity for his two children.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Lee A Hamilton in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Lee A Hamilton in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing at request of Defense. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lee A Hamilton in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lee A Hamilton in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 08-17-2015 at 01:30pm
